Package com.example.ghostkitchen.controller

Class RestaurantController

java.lang.Object
com.example.ghostkitchen.controller.RestaurantController
@RestController
public class RestaurantController
extends java.lang.Object
REST endpoints for Restaurants
Author:
Sherzod Nimatullo

  • Constructor Details

    • RestaurantController

      public RestaurantController()

  • Method Details

    • getRestaurantInfo

      @GetMapping("/restaurants/{id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> getRestaurantInfo​(@PathVariable java.lang.Long id)
      This method returns a restaurant using the ID that was passed.
      Parameters:
      id - Restaurant ID
      Returns:
      A 200 status code with restaurant information.

    • addRestaurant

      @PostMapping("/owner/restaurants/add") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> addRestaurant​(@RequestBody RestaurantRequest request, @CurrentUser UserPrincipal owner)
      This method adds a restaurant into the database and RestaurantRepo. We get the current user using the ID from UserPrincipal. A restaurant object is created using the information from the RestaurantRequest.
      Parameters:
      request - RestaurantRequest object which is the JSON request converted into a Java object.
      owner - Currently logged in user.
      Returns:
      Success Http Status Code ResponseEntity

    • getRestaurants

      @GetMapping("/restaurants/{id}/menu") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> getRestaurants​(@PathVariable java.lang.Long id)
      This method returns the menu for a specified restaurant. We first fetch the restaurant using the ID provided from the URL. We get the list of menu items and return a RestaurantResponse.
      Parameters:
      id - Path Variable for the restaurant id to be fetched.
      Returns:
      RestaurantResponse encapsulated in ResponseEntity.

    • menuCategories

      @GetMapping("/restaurants/{id}/categories") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> menuCategories​(@PathVariable java.lang.Long id)
      This method returns the list of categories for a specified restaurant offers. Each menu item has a category.
      Parameters:
      id - Restaurant ID
      Returns:
      A 200 status code

    • getListOfCategories

      @GetMapping("/restaurants/categories") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> getListOfCategories​(@CurrentUser UserPrincipal principal)
      This method returns the list of categories for the current logged in owner's restaurant.
      Parameters:
      principal - User principal
      Returns:
      A 200 status code

    • addMenuItem

      @PostMapping("/owner/restaurants/{id}/menu/add") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> addMenuItem​(@PathVariable java.lang.Long id, @RequestParam java.util.Optional<org.springframework.web.multipart.MultipartFile> picture, @RequestParam java.lang.String name, @RequestParam java.lang.String description, @RequestParam java.math.BigDecimal price, @RequestParam java.lang.String category)
      This method add a new Menu Item to the logged in user's restaurant. We first create a new MenuItem object with the information from the JSON. We assign the owner's restaurant to the Menu Item. If a picture is present, then we save the picture as a file using a UUID as the name in our file system and generate a URL for it using the ServletUriComponentsBuilder.
      Parameters:
      id - Restaurant ID
      picture - Image of the item.
      name - Name of the item.
      description - Description for the item.
      price - Price for the item.
      category - Category assigned to the item.
      Returns:
      A 200 status code

    • updateItem

      @PutMapping("/menu/edit/{id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> updateItem​(@PathVariable java.lang.Long id, @RequestParam java.util.Optional<org.springframework.web.multipart.MultipartFile> picture, @RequestParam java.lang.String name, @RequestParam java.lang.String description, @RequestParam java.math.BigDecimal price)
      This method allows us to update an existing item. We first find the item using the ID and make the appropriate changes. After, we save the object.
      Parameters:
      id - MenuItem id
      picture - New item picture
      name - New item name
      description - New item description
      price - New item price.
      Returns:
      A 200 status code

    • allRestaurants

      @GetMapping("/restaurants/all") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> allRestaurants()
      This method returns a list of all the restaurants available on Ghost Kitchens.
      Returns:
      List of restaurant objects.

    • downloadFile

      @Deprecated @GetMapping("/downloadFile/{fileName}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<org.springframework.core.io.Resource> downloadFile​(@PathVariable java.lang.String fileName, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      Deprecated.

    • getMenuItems

      @GetMapping("/MyRestaurant") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> getMenuItems​(@CurrentUser UserPrincipal principal)
      This method returns the restaurant information for the current logged in owner.
      Parameters:
      principal - User principal
      Returns:
      A 200 status code with restaurant info.

    • getRatings

      @GetMapping("/MyRestaurant/ratings") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> getRatings​(@CurrentUser UserPrincipal principal)
      This method returns a list of ratings for the current logged in owner's restaurant.
      Parameters:
      principal - User principal
      Returns:
      A 200 status code with list of ratings.

    • addRating

      @PutMapping("/restaurants/{id}/addRating") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> addRating​(@CurrentUser UserPrincipal principal, @RequestBody Rating rating, @PathVariable java.lang.Long id)
      This method allows a customer to leave a rating for a restaurant. We find the restaurant using the id passed from the url. Then we add the rating into the restaurant. The addRating method also calculates the average rating for a restaurant.
      Parameters:
      principal - User principal
      rating - Rating for the restaurant
      id - Restaurant id.
      Returns:
      A 200 status code.

    • hasRating

      @GetMapping("/restaurants/{id}/rated") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> hasRating​(@CurrentUser UserPrincipal principal, @PathVariable java.lang.Long id)
      This method checks whether or not the current logged in customer has rated a restaurant.
      Parameters:
      principal - User principal
      id - Restaurant ID
      Returns:
      A 200 status code

    • bestCustomer

      @GetMapping("/restaurants/bestCustomer") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> bestCustomer​(@CurrentUser UserPrincipal principal)
      This method finds the most frequent customer for the current logged in owner's restaurant.
      Parameters:
      principal - User principal.
      Returns:
      A 200 status code with the most frequent customer.

    • getOrdersByDate

      @GetMapping("/restaurants/getListOfCustomers") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> getOrdersByDate​(@CurrentUser UserPrincipal principal)
      This method returns a list of customers for the current logged in owner's restaurant.
      Parameters:
      principal - User principal.
      Returns:
      A 200 status code with the list of customers.
